Facebook Users Can Now Share, View 360-Degree Photos

According to film producer Kevin Cornish, who spoke about this at South by Southwest, the world of fashion is ripe for adopting virtual reality, particularly in marketing and e-commerce. Because it’s so immersive, he said, virtual reality can be emotional and persuasive. “People talk about it being an ‘empathy machine,’” he said.

Kevin Cornish on The Future of Interactive Storytelling

Kevin Cornish is a LA-based VR filmmaker who teamed up with AMD to do some interactive narrative experiments using gazed-based content in Believe VR. Road to VR interviewed Kevin at GDC – Game Developers Conference where he shared with me his ideas about writing interactive narratives, first-person storytelling for mute characters using the reluctant protagonist as a guide, stories where characters empathize with you, and the role of emotion and eye contact in immersive experiences.

Step Inside a Marco Marco Runway Show in this 360 Video

L.A. label Marco Marco has always boasted exciting runway shows thanks to a habit of using gay icons, drag queens and porn stars to show off its latest designs – and now it’s found a way to let everyone share the experience: 360 VR video directed by Jason Koffeman, Executive Produced by Kevin Cornish. “Virtual reality lets viewers feel an experience never before possible,” said Moth + Flame VR’s Kevin Cornish. Marco is a true visionary, so what better way to bring the rush of his latest inspiration to the world than through this visionary new medium?”

AMD’s Roy Taylor: “VR Is Very, Very Much Driving Innovation” (VRLA)

While the movers and shakers of Hollywood were in Park City, Utah absorbing the Sundance VR buzz, thousands of virtual reality enthusiasts descended upon the Los Angeles Convention Center for the VRLA Expo. Roy Taylor is quoted here: “there’s a very talented young director in Hollywood called Kevin Cornish who showed an experience at VRLA based on what’s called “gaze activated content.”
